Note: Participant notices that watching video while glasses transcribe live audio is not overwhelming and feels that eyes shift seamlessly between external screen and MR glasses display
Participant notes that live captioning feature accurately reflects audio
Participant positions head and eyes just above the phone screen so that MR glasses display the live captions slightly above the video

Participant expresses dislike for the live captioning feature as they feel like they have to be more conscious of head positioning since they must focus on both MR display and phone screen (head or phone must be placed in a specific position to avoid jumbled content) and neck feels strained
Participant says that users might enjoy the live captioning feature more if they are unable to watch something but can still hear and see live captions in the glasses

Participant does not see a purpose in the live captioning feature and says their opinion would not change even if they were watching content on a bigger screen while MR glasses displayed live captions
Participant notices that captions are slightly delayed but not too slow and expresses general satisfaction
